Package controller

Class ModifyProductForm

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyProductForm
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductForm extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the controller for modifying products in the Inventory Management System app.

      public ModifyProductForm()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the "Modify Product" page of the app. The modify product table will be populated with the values of the product that was selected by the user.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resourceBundle - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

    • onAddButton

      public void onAddButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent ActionEvent)
      Adds the selected part in the parts table to the associated parts table and is populated there.
      Parameters:
      ActionEvent - Event of taking the selected part from the table and setting the values to the associated parts table.

    • onCancelButton

      public void onCancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method will cancel the current actions on the page and return the the main Inventory Management System page. It will bring up a pop-up window to confirm whether to exit or not.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, the action of notifying the user and confirming cancellation from the "Modify Part Form" page.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • toMainForm

      public void toMainForm(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This is the method used to go back to the main page titled "Inventory Management System".
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The action of returning to the home page of the app titled "Inventory Management System".
      Throws:
      IOException

    • onPartSearchButton

      public void onPartSearchButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method takes all of the part input from the user and sets them in the corresponding variables to save. An error message will popup in the scenario that certain criteria are not met. These scenarios are: user not inputting integers for machine ID, inputting invalid values or leaving the fields blank, and not setting the proper stock values.
      Parameters:
      event - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, setting all the part variables and notifying the user if there are any improper inputs.

    • addPartSearchClicked

      public void addPartSearchClicked(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      This method will check to see if the parts search field for Parts table in the app is empty. If empty, the table will be repopulated and shown to the user of whatever the inventory is.
      Parameters:
      event - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, resets the parts table to show all the existing parts.

    • onRemoveButton

      public void onRemoveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method will remove the associated part from the table and provide a dialog window to the user to confirm removal.
      Parameters:
      event - Event action will remove the associated part from the table.

    • onSaveButton

      public void onSaveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      This method takes all of the part input from the user and sets them in the corresponding variables. An error message will popup in the scenario that certain criteria are not met. These scenarios are: user not inputting integers for machine ID, inputting invalid values or leaving the fields blank, and not setting the proper stock values.
      Parameters:
      event - Represents that the method will perform some action. In this case, setting all the part variables and notifying the user if there are any improper inputs.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • minStock

      public boolean minStock(int min, int max)
      This method ensures that the inventory value set by the user is less than or equal to the maximum stock and greater than or equal to the minimum stock. If the value is out of these bounds, an error message is displayed to the user.
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum value of the inventory for the part.
      max - The maximum value of the inventory for the part.
      Returns:
      Returns the value of true to the validStock variable if the conditions of the method are met (inventory between min and max).
